The lifespan’s birth year, month, and day are called *mingzào* (命造), while death’s year, month, and day are called *huàmìng* (化命). The *Exhortation to Virtue* speaks of prolonging life or shortening it, and of fate being exhausted leading to death—all asserting that what is formed must perish, and what is created must transform. Hence, it is said, *"Zàohuà wú gēntí"* (造化无根蒂).

Though the yin essence and yang qi within a human body are also rooted in what Heaven endows, Heaven and Earth themselves rely on these yin and yang to form shapes and bodies. Heaven and Earth merely forget their forms and bodies, not burdening their spirit with material substance, thus using this yin and yang to give birth to all beings.

Humans are the most refined of all things, knowing to revere the high and humble the low, imitating Heaven and following Earth, cultivating emptiness within and substance without to nourish the formless. Within them, the interplay of these two qi moves like the *Wújí Yuānbù* (无极元始) qi—endlessly swelling and waning, like fish in water, perpetually interconnected.

Yet those who do not return to the source are like a single ladle of water or a pinch of earth—played with briefly before the ladle shatters and the pinch scatters, with water returning to the sea and dust to the earth. But those who return to the source naturally align with their origin. A ladle of water preserved without clinging to its vessel remains ever in its source; a pinch of earth settled with sincerity cultivates virtue without ceasing. Over time, water gathers into lakes, earth accumulates into mountains—gradually filling lakes to become seas, embracing emptiness to merge with the *Tàiqīng* (太清), condensing to expand mountains into earth, bearing *Huáyuè* (华岳) with solidity. All this is the original essence of that ladle of water and pinch of earth.

Humans accumulate essence and qi to form spirit, refine emptiness and nourish vastness to attain the Dao—this belongs to the intrinsic response to the source. Laozi’s *"Gǔshén bùsǐ"* (谷神不死) is rooted with Heaven and Earth at the *Xuānpìn* (玄牝) gate! Hence, it is said, *"Yīnyáng yǒu běnyuán"* (阴阳有本源)—though this is only a *zhōngpǐn* (中品) explanation.

As for the *shàngpǐn* (上品) elixir method, there exists a prior move, a direct path through the *Kǒngdào* (孔道), where the *Xuānguān* (玄关) may be instantly realized. One naturally perceives the mysteries of the *Dàodé* (道德) first chapter, knowing that human spirit shares the same *zàohuà* (造化) as Heaven and Earth—that is, the same *Yuānbù miàowúwéi* (元始妙无为) root.

Human qi, like all things, draws from yin and yang—that is, from the *Língbǎo miàoyǒuwéi* (灵宝妙有为) source. It is not like the laborious gathering of multitudes or heaps of earth; it requires only a sincere, unshaken thought, ensuring uninterrupted practice and swift return.

Thus, when discussing *zàohuà* through yin and yang, these belong to the post-heaven realm, manifesting in humans as the *sèsēn* (色身). If lifespan is neither prolonged nor shortened, and one adheres to the *shàn dào* (善道) of guarding death, this is the *Dàrén* (大人) practicing *"Hòutiān ér fèng tiānshí"* (后天而奉天时).

Hence, Yán Zǐ did not die young—not because his *sèsēn* was fated to perish, but because he could *"Chángwú yǐ guān qí miào"* (常无以观其妙). Zháojí did not live long—not because his *sèsēn* was fated to dissolve, but because he failed to *"Chángwú yǐ guān qí miào"*.

If *zàohuà* is understood through yin and yang, then *zàohuà* originates from the pre-heaven realm, manifesting in humans as the *fǎshēn* (法身). If wisdom and fate can restore their source and return to their origin, they naturally respond to all things in constancy, attaining their true nature. This is the *Dàrén* practicing *"Xiāntiān ér tiān bù wéi"* (先天而天不违).

Thus, beings cycle through the *Liùdào* (六道) wheel, while sages and kings cannot become Buddhas because they sacrifice their *fǎshēn* to yin and yang’s likes and dislikes, failing to *"Chángyǒu yǐ guān qí jiào"* (常有以观其徼). The *Wén Dì*’s seventeen incarnations, Laozi’s eighty-one transformations—these follow yin and yang’s movement and stillness, thus able to *"Chángyǒu yǐ guān qí jiào"*.

Hence, it is said:
*"Sèsēn píng zàohuà, yóu tiān bù yóu jǐ"* (色身凭造化，由天不由己)—since one has no root to rely on.
*"Fǎshēn guàn yīnyáng, yóu wǒ bù yóu tiān"* (法身贯阴阳，由我不由天)—since one has a source to penetrate.

Heaven aids the sincere; nothing is unlucky.

Yet all things arise from existence, and existence from non-existence. Non-existence is the source of existence, while existence is the root of non-existence. Thus, existence and non-existence are movement and stillness; movement and stillness are yin and yang; yin and yang are *zàohuà*; *zàohuà* are existence and non-existence.

I need not distinguish between existence and non-existence, yin and yang, creation and transformation. Only in my every movement and stillness do they mutually root, without preference or aversion, following the *Wángdào* (王道).

If one nourishes the *fǎshēn* with the *sèsēn*, then gathering is form, scattering is qi. If one stabilizes the *sèsēn* with the *fǎshēn*, stillness becomes the *Jīndān* (金丹), movement becomes thunderous lightning. What birth, what death, what preservation, what annihilation?

As Mèngzǐ said:
*"Tiān shòu bù èr, xiūshēn yǐ sì zhī, suǒyǐ lì mìng yě."*
(天寿不贰，修身以俟之，所以立命也.)
How could there be a division between life and death?

And again:
*"Wànwù jiē bèi yú wǒ yǐ! Fǎnshēn ér chéng, lè mò zài yān."*
(万物皆备于我矣！反身而诚，乐莫在焉.)
How could there be a distinction between preservation and annihilation?

Thus, one may awaken to the effortless ease of those who are ever responsive and ever still!

Qi is like water, spirit like earth. Qi is what fate depends on; spirit is what nature entrusts. The wise delight in water to nourish qi, acting without contrivance to cultivate wisdom. The virtuous take joy in mountains to solidify spirit, dwelling in earth to cultivate sincerity without wavering, thus fostering tranquility.

Let me exhaust this principle of simultaneously cultivating nature and fate: first, store the spirit in the heart; settle the spirit to still the mind; forget the mind to nourish the form; forget the form to nourish the qi; forget the qi to nourish the spirit; forget the spirit to nourish the void.

chunks.original_text: 是得颜子之坐忘，即尽我性以致乎命，更能忘虚以合道，则天亦纵之将圣，自然元命复而元性还。 性命完全，毋意毋必毋固毋我，遂并合乎先天元始之一气，即是与道合真，贯古今而常存，参天地而不贰，动则为太极之永贞，流行而无滞； 静则为无极之真一，得主而有常。 夫即有常，则无常者皆归掌握； 无滞，则有滞者亦会贯通。 先儒周子所谓“五行一阴阳也，阴阳一太极也，太极本无极也。 ”无极固无，太极即有也，造化之根、阴阳之本固在是也。 而岂甘被阴阳束缚在五行之中，空自贪生怕死、较有论无？ 要当直采其根本，会得其枢要，超出乎造化之窠臼，方可名为得道之士矣！ 这些真正妙处，色法生死交关，若不自体自悟，穷理尽性，皈神真师幕下，大家正念当空，无声无臭，印证一番，从而自定自立、自返自还、自归自复、自成自证、自解自脱，虽父子之至恩有不能相传者也。 吾龙门七祖昆阳王子所以说到“了悟生死”之后而曰：“认得真，连夜走，觅个柱儿无一有； 空空荡荡独修行，不渴不饥天地寿。 ”二十二章注内所述“用六”之“利永贞”，而“用九”之“见群龙无首吉”也，如是如是。 ○上第六十三章。 此承上四章，姑就中品阐法戒之，以造化之无根蒂，董之以阴阳之有本源，显现穷理尽性之端倪，教人自己体认了悟生死直臻妙有妙无之圣境，以返本还源，惬与上品丹法修证无异，乃知孔子所谓“原始及终，故知生死”之说，即此之谓也。 得此真妙可与权矣。 此为通篇眼目点睛特笔，并以发明上文第四十九章至五十四章炼成谷神之总诀，以起下文各章之意。 ※《周易·系辞传》“原始及终。 ”及字见汉儒注本：“言人能原始以及终，故知生死之说也。 ”语意极亮，今从之。 ]
chunks.translated_text:
Thus, one attains **Master Yan’s** *zuòwáng* (坐忘), exhausting one’s nature to fulfill fate, and further forgetting the void to merge with the Dao—then Heaven itself will grant one sainthood, and the Original Command and Original Nature will naturally return.

When nature and fate are complete, there is no scheming, no certainty, no rigidity, no self—thus merging with the primordial *yīqì* (一氣) of Preheaven, this is the union with the True Dao, transcending past and present while ever enduring, participating in Heaven and Earth without division. In motion, it becomes the eternal constancy of the Great Ultimate; in flow, it is unobstructed. In stillness, it is the True One of the Non-Ultimate, secure and unchanging.

If one attains this constancy, then all impermanence falls under command; if unobstructed, then all obstruction will be penetrated.

As the earlier Confucian scholar Zhouzi (周子) said:
*"The Five Phases are but one yin-yang; yin-yang is but the Great Ultimate; the Great Ultimate originates from the Non-Ultimate."*

The Non-Ultimate is indeed void; the Great Ultimate is indeed existence—the root of transformation, the origin of yin-yang. How could one willingly be bound by yin-yang, confined within the Five Phases, vainly clinging to life while fearing death, debating existence over nonexistence?

One must instead grasp its fundamental root, comprehend its pivotal essence, and transcend the confines of transformation—only then may one be called a true Daoist.

These profound truths, where life and death intersect with colored phenomena, cannot be transmitted by father to son if one does not personally embody and awaken, exhausting principle and fulfilling nature, returning to the True Teacher beneath the divine canopy. With pure mindfulness unfettered, silent and scentless, one must verify it oneself—thus self-stabilizing, self-establishing, self-reverting, self-restoring, self-returning, self-fulfilling, self-liberating. Even the deepest filial bonds cannot convey this.

Hence, the seventh patriarch of Longmen, Master Wang Ziyuan of Kunyang, declared after enlightenment:
*"Recognize the True—run all night,
Seek a pillar with neither existence nor nonexistence.
Empty, vast, and solitary in cultivation,
Neither thirst nor hunger—Heaven’s longevity."*

As stated in the annotations of the Twenty-Two Chapters, *"The advantage of using Six"* is *"eternal constancy,"* while *"The advantage of using Nine"* is *"seeing the dragons without a head—auspicious."*

○ **Chapter Sixty-Three (上第六十三章).**

This follows the preceding four chapters, elaborating on the middle-grade precepts, demonstrating that transformation lacks roots while yin-yang has its source, revealing the beginnings of exhausting principle and fulfilling nature. It teaches self-realization, awakening to life and death, and directly attaining the sacred realm of wondrous existence and wondrous nonexistence—thus returning to the origin and source, aligning with the highest-grade elixir cultivation and verification. Only then does one grasp Confucius’ saying: *"To trace the beginning and the end, thus knowing life and death."* This is what he meant.

This true profundity may now be applied with skill.

This is the pivotal eye-opening insight of the entire passage, elucidating the overarching key of refining the Valley Spirit in Chapters Forty-Nine to Fifty-Four, and setting the stage for the subsequent chapters.

※ From *Zhouyi · Xìcí Zhuàn* (《周易·系辞传》): *"Original beginning and end."* The character *jí* (及) is taken from the Han scholar’s annotation: *"He who traces the beginning and attains the end knows the saying of life and death."* The meaning is clear; thus, I follow it.

chunks.original_text: 留汞居金鼎，将铅入玉池。 主宾无左右，只要识婴儿。 汞指神，铅指气。 金鼎指人身中，上有天谷，即婴儿时藏神之府也。 玉池指人身中，中有应谷，即婴儿时藏气之府也。 婴儿指元命即复，谷神初化之阳神也。 此承上文五十四章，元命来复之际而言。 此神已由应谷寄宫养到充足，乘气腾转周天，移归本位泥丸宫中，遂留居于天谷，是为谷神。 石子谓是分胎，白子谓之移神换鼎，故曰“留汞居金鼎”。 而气亦自复其本位，入于应谷绛官，故曰“将铅入玉池。 ”此不假作为，自然转移。 张子《悟真票》云：“用将须分左右军，饶他为主我为宾。 ”此章特为剖晰其旨，教人饶气为主而神为宾，并无左右之分，与道合真而归于不死不生。 惟神安藏于密，不于分外造作以求生，是以气亦浩然，权且留神以不死。 此惟婴儿为能如是纯气之守也，故曰：“主宾无左右，只要识婴儿。 ”教人此际得此阳神，正与婴儿初生无异，只要如婴儿纯气以守纯阳之体，则阳神自壮长矣！ ○上第六十四章。 统上九章，皆以发明穷理尽性之微旨，以致元命来复之由，及命复时自然之功用。 下章遂言温养之道。 ]

Lead refers to the qi.

The golden cauldron denotes within the body
The Upper Valley (*Tiāngǔ*), where in infancy the spirit is stored.

The jade pool denotes within the body
The Middle Valley (*Yìnggǔ*), where in infancy the qi is stored.

The infant refers to the Original Command’s return—
The nascent spirit of the Valley’s first transformation.

This follows Chapter Fifty-Four,
Speaking of the moment when the Original Command returns.

This spirit, having been nurtured in the Middle Valley until fullness,
Riding the qi ascends and circulates the Microcosmic Orbit,
Then returns to its original position in the Mud Ball Palace,
Thus remaining in the Upper Valley—this is the Valley Spirit.

The stone child calls this *division of the embryo*,
The white child calls it *transference of the spirit and exchange of the cauldron*—
Hence, *"retain the mercury in the golden cauldron."*

And the qi likewise returns to its original position,
Entering the Middle Valley’s vermilion chamber—
Hence, *"lead into the jade pool."*

This shift requires no artificial effort;
It moves naturally.

Master Zhang’s *Awakening to Reality* states:
*"When using, divide left and right armies—
Let the other be host, I the guest."*

This chapter clarifies its essence,
Teaching that qi should be host and spirit the guest—
No distinction of left or right,
Thus aligning with the Dao’s authenticity and returning to neither death nor birth.

Only when the spirit is securely hidden within
Does it not seek life through external contrivance—
Hence the qi flows boundlessly,
Temporarily retaining the spirit to avoid death.

Only the infant can guard such pure qi,
Thus: *"Host and guest know no left nor right—
Only recognize the infant."*

At this moment, one attains this nascent spirit,
Just as the infant at birth—
Only guard the pure qi as the infant does,
And the pure yang body will naturally flourish!

○ **Chapter Sixty-Four**

Summarizing the past nine chapters,
All elucidating the subtle essence of exhausting principle and perfecting nature,
Revealing the origin of the Original Command’s return,
And the natural functions at the moment of its return.

The next chapter will speak of the method of gentle nurturing.

The Yellow Nurse’s twin breasts are fair,
The Old Man’s single heart is kind.
No other method in gentle nurturing—
Only from the Void, the child is raised.

The Old Man points to the heart:
At the moment of Original Command’s return,
When all is settled and at rest,
One must not cling to any *having*—
Only nurture the formless spirit,
Mastering purity with unwavering devotion,
Guest to lead and mercury in solemn stillness,
Then the qi flows naturally to nourish the spirit-chamber.

Like a nurse feeding her child,
Let it drink as it will,
Her heart tender and yielding,
Following the qi’s course,
Ever watchful and returning—
Thus the body grows uniformly warm,
And the infant thrives naturally, needing no other art.

The Void is the meaning of *not-having*.
As the *Golden Lotus Sutra* says:
*"If one seeks me through form or sound, it is not so."*
Only the method of *Observation of Self-Nature* suffices—
To forget form, forget qi,
And nurture the spirit that is not-spirit.

○ **Chapter Sixty-Five**

This follows the previous chapter,
Revealing the fire’s timing in gentle nurturing—
Only the secret of forgetting form
Is the way to cultivate the Grain-Spirit.

○ **Chapter Sixty-Six**

Within the vessel, the sky of Heaven never darkens,
And fine, white snow descends in delicate flakes.

The crimson gate—
This refers to the **Zhonggu** (Midgut), the place where the **Ying** (Response) resonates in the **Jiangong** (Crimson Palace).
The soaring **Qingfeng** (Azure Phoenix)—
This signifies that at this moment, the **qi** emerges fresh from its original position in the **Jiangong**, like the **Qingfeng** (Azure Phoenix) taking flight.
As the *Yinfu Jing* (Scripture of the Mysterious Response) states: *"The bird is within the qi,"*
Hence, the **Qingfeng** is likened to the **qi**.
The *Shiming* (Explication of Names) says: *"Qing, means 'to generate.'*
Thus, the **Qingfeng** (Azure Phoenix) symbolizes the **qi** in its nascent state.

The **Dantian** (Elixir Field) here refers to the **Upper Dantian**,**—**
That is, the **Tiangu** (Heavenly Grain), the **Nihuan Gong** (Mud Pillow Palace).
The **Yushen** (Jade Hare)—
This denotes the **yang** spirit within the **Gutian** (Grain-Sky), now nurtured and no longer cold as in its initial state, but warm as jade.

The **white snow**—
This signifies the **qi** circulating to the **Gutian** (Grain-Sky), where it mingles with the spirit, forming **shenwater** (spirit-essence).
Its **qi** is clear, pure, and pervasive, like white snow.

At this stage, the **yang** spirit has grown strong and must not be disturbed—
It rests naturally in its **not-spirit** state;
The **qi** flows freely on its own,
Like the **Qingfeng** (Azure Phoenix) ascending to the **Nihuan Gong** (Mud Pillow Palace),
Nourishing this spirit.
When the spirit and **qi** unite, they become **shenwater** (spirit-essence),
And it descends like fine, white snow,
Filling the entire body.
One feels uniformly clear and serene,
As though the body were a sky that never darkens.

○ This is **Chapter Sixty-Six**.
This describes the phenomenon of the **qi** flowing freely during the **warming-nurturing** phase—
Such is the true method of **nurturing life**,
How does it compare to the various minor techniques of life-nurturing in *The Chui Xu Yin* (Jade Emptiness Ode)?
With a **clear heart and bright eyes**, one can surely discern the difference.

chunks.original_text: 琴瑟合谐后，箕裘了当时。 不须行火候，又恐损婴儿。 言此时温养元神，不比从前冶炼谷神火候。 盖此时谷神已与命气配合，正如琴瑟已谐之后，任气周旋。 阳神巳壮，即是箕裘了当之时，更无情识好恶之牵缠。 若再用心火调度，劳神暴气，则气不充乎虚，神亦难完夫实，何时得就？ 阳神为损不小，故教人尽管放下身心，安神静谧，任气流行，自然充实，断不可究其火候也。 ○上第六十七章。 此言温养，不可助长。 盖前则尽性以致命，此时又当安命以率性，方克还手本源也。 ] 长男才入兑，少女便归乾。 巽宫并土位，关锁自周天。 长男指露，象阳初生。 少女指兑，象阳已壮，入兑归乾，乃依先天卦位爻象而言，指阳方初生一阳为震，递长至两爻即为兑——兑为少女——再长至三爻即为纯阳乾象。 曰才入，曰便归，以明阳神长成甚速也。 巽宫指人身鼻窍。 土位指形体，曰并者，即前四十九章所谓艮坤宫也。 盖一阴为巽，两阴即为艮，三阴即为坤——为土位也。 言人自性定命复以来，阳神初如震卦一阳藏于天谷任气流行，体即壮长如兑二阳，旋即充满便是纯乾，神遂正位居体； 而气亦遂如巽宫一阴初息，旋即寂如艮止，静如抽藏，美在其中而畅于四肢，美之至矣！ 是神以能凝而愈壮，气亦能寂而愈充，理有固然，应无偏胜之患。 然而胞胎内一分血气究未尽除，此时若不戒严深藏宥密，复恐好动而不安于静。 其行止坐卧之间，鼻息自听有声，形体驰骤劳顿，则气返动心，神常外驰，便为透关漏气。 将来成就道果亦偏而不圆，因其气胜神也。 故必要真息悠悠，形体申申，容色夭夭，顺六气以周流，随周天之运度，气机自然关锁于内，无偏胜流失之弊，方为善养浩然也。 ○上第六十八章。 此言温养壮盛之际，不假作为，只须制节谨度以保满而不溢也。 ] 弦后弦前处，月圆月缺时。 抽添象刑德，沐浴按盈亏。 弦后弦前喻气象之消息，月圆月缺指气质之盈亏，刚治为刑，柔服为德。 言当此神旺气足之时，浩气之流行已自充塞乎天地，固不可任其动荡，亦不可稍有抑制，只须因盈而抽、因虚而添，仍用刚克柔克之道，使此正气常自冲和以为沐浴，则体常舒泰广大宽平，以待先天元阳遘夏还元可也。 总之，气体愈旺，则神愈退藏，勿使神为气役，则阳神自得圆足也。 ○上第六十九章。 此言持盈之时，务使神清气静，勿使神气二者有过不及之弊。 ] 老汞三斤白，真铅一点红。 夺他天地髓，交媾片时中。 老汞者，合全体之精气神而成者也。 三斤者，即指此三品分两皆足之谓也。 白者，纯完本色不染之谓也。 真铅，乃我太极中有先天一点无极元阳真气，即我之元性也。 真铅无形无色，而此曰一点者，以见是一非二，是点非滴。 曰红者，张子所谓“以黑而变红”是也。 夫人之秉彝本乎天性，性赋自天而降衷于人为心，心于五色为赤。 而此时所复之性乃天地之元住，本无极所赋于太极以为心者。 故太清至真上帝所居之境为大赤天宫，而先辈每以本来元性唤作金丹，尊此来复之元性谓之曰先天太极道德真人。 《中庸》所谓“尊德性”，即尊此元性也，非气质之性也。 兹不曰赤而曰红者，以前所得之铅已因水火之间色而成紫。

After the **qinsè** (zither and se) harmonize, the **jīqiú** (winnowing basket and quilt) is set aside.
The **qi** flows freely without need of **fires** (refining techniques),
Yet one must not fear harming the **baby** (nascent spirit).

This is when the **original spirit** (元神) is tempered and nurtured,
Not the same as before when the **grain spirit** (谷神) was refined by **fires** (火候).
For now, the **grain spirit** has already merged with the **life-qi** (命气),
Just as the **qinsè** has harmonized, and the **qi** circulates freely.
When the **yang spirit** (陽神) is fully matured,
It is the time when the **jīqiú** is truly complete—
No longer bound by **emotions** (情) or **desires** (识好恶).

If one still stirs the **heart-fire** (心火) to refine,
Exhausting the spirit and **violating the qi** (暴气),
Then the **qi** will not fully fill the **emptiness** (虚),
And the spirit will struggle to attain its **completeness** (完夫实).
When will this ever be achieved?
The **yang spirit** will be damaged beyond measure—
Thus one must simply let go of body and mind,
Calm the spirit and still the **qi**,
Let it flow freely on its own,
Naturally filling and complete—
Never probing its **fires** (火候).

○ **Chapter Sixty-Seven**.
This speaks of **nurturing life** (温养) without **forcing** (助长).
Before, one exhausted the **nature** (性) to attain the **life-qi** (命),
Now one must nurture the **life-qi** to guide the **nature** (性),
Only then can one return to the **root source** (本源).

---

When the **eldest son** (長男) enters **Dui** (Joy),
The **young maiden** (少女) returns to **Qian** (Heaven),
The **Xun Palace** (巽宫) aligns with the **earthly position** (土位),
And the **passageways** (关锁) are sealed within the **Great Circulation** (周天).
The **eldest son** refers to **Lu** (Exposure), symbolizing **yang** (陽) in its nascent form.
The **young maiden** refers to **Dui** (Joy), symbolizing **yang** (陽) now mature—
Entering **Dui** and returning to **Qian**,
This is the **original heaven** (先天) **hexagram** (卦) and **line** (爻) imagery:
The first **yang** (一陽) as **Zhen** (Thunder),
Growing to two lines as **Dui** (Joy)—
**Dui** is the **young maiden** (少女)—
Then to three lines as the **pure yang** (纯陽) **Qian** (Heaven) symbol.
The terms **"just entering"** (才入) and **"already returns"** (便归)
Show how swiftly the **yang spirit** (陽神) matures.

The **Xun Palace** (巽宫) is the **nasal orifice** (鼻窍) of the body.
The **earthly position** (土位) refers to the **physical form** (形体)—
**"Aligning"** (并) is the **Gen-Kun Palace** (艮坤宫) as mentioned in **Chapter Forty-Nine**.
For one **yin** (一阴) is **Xun** (Wind), two **yin** become **Gen** (Mountain),
Three **yin** become **Kun** (Earth)—
This is the **earthly position** (土位).
From the time the **nature** (性) determines the **life-qi** (命),
The **yang spirit** (陽神) initially hides like **Zhen** (Thunder)’s single **yang** (陽),
Concealed within the **heavens**, as the **grain spirit** (谷神) and **life-qi** (命气) flow,
The body grows strong like **Dui**’s two **yang** (二陽),
Then swiftly fills as the **pure yang** (纯陽) **Qian** (Heaven) symbol—
The spirit now dwells in its **proper position** (正位) within the body.

While the **qi** too, like the **Xun Palace**’s single **yin** (一阴), initially rests,
Then stills as **Gen**’s **arrest** (止),
And withdraws like **Kun**’s **concealment** (藏),
Filling the body and flowing freely through the **four limbs** (四肢),
Reaching its utmost perfection!

For the spirit grows stronger through **concentration** (凝),
And the **qi** becomes more abundant through **stillness** (寂),
This is the natural order—
There should be no **excess or deficiency** (偏胜).

Yet within the **uterus** (胞胎), a trace of **blood-qi** (血气) remains uneliminated.
If one does not **guard strictly** (戒严), **withdraw deeply** (深藏), and **keep secret** (宥密),
There is still fear of **excessive movement** (好动) and **not abiding in stillness** (不安于静).
In **movement, stillness, sitting, or lying** (行止坐卧),
If one hears the **nasal breath** (鼻息) as having sound,
Or if the **body** (形体) is **exhausted** (驰骤), **labored** (劳顿),
Then the **qi** will **return to agitation** (返动心),
And the spirit will **constantly stray outward** (神常外驰),
Leading to **leaking the **Passageway** and losing the **qi**** (透关漏气).
Future attainment of the **Dao fruit** (道果) will be **unbalanced** (偏) rather than **complete** (圆),
For the **qi** overpowers the spirit.

Thus it is essential to have **true breath** (真息) flowing **leisurely** (悠悠),
The **body** (形体) **relaxed** (申申),
The **appearance and complexion** (容色) **serene** (夭夭),
Following the **Six Qi** (六气) in their **circulation** (周流),
Conforming to the **Great Circulation**’s **rhythm** (运度),
So the **qi mechanisms** (气机) naturally **seal and lock within** (关锁于内),
Without the **flaws of imbalance or dissipation** (偏胜流失),
This is the **true nurturing of the Great Qi** (善养浩然).

○ **Chapter Sixty-Eight**.
This speaks of the **nurturing life** phase when the **qi** is **strong and mature** (壮盛),
Requiring no **artificial effort** (不假作为),
Only **restraint and moderation** (制节谨度) to preserve **fullness without overflow** (满而不溢).

---

The **strings** (弦) after and before,
The **full and waning moons** (月圆月缺).
**Withdrawing** (抽) and **adding** (添) mirror **punishment** (刑) and **virtue** (德),
**Bathing** (沐浴) and **adjusting** (按) follow the **swell and ebb** (盈亏).
**"Strings after and before"** (弦后弦前) illustrate the **qi’s** **ebb and flow** (消息),
**"Full and waning moons"** (月圆月缺) point to the **qi’s** **swell and ebb** (盈亏).
**Harshness** (刚) governs as **punishment** (刑),
**Softness** (柔) yields as **virtue** (德).

At this time when the **spirit is flourishing** (神旺) and the **qi is abundant** (气足),
The **Great Qi** (浩气) flows freely, filling **heaven and earth** (天地).
One must not let it **agitate** (动荡),
Nor **suppress it** (抑制).
Only **withdraw when full** (因盈而抽) and **supplement when depleted** (因虚而添),
Still applying the **method of firmness overcoming softness** (刚克柔克),
So that this **true qi** (正气) **constantly harmonizes and refreshes** (冲和以为沐浴),
Then the **body** (体) will always be **relaxed and expansive** (舒泰广大宽平),
Waiting for the **original heaven’s yang** (先天元阳) to **encounter summer and return to origin** (遘夏还元).

In summary,
The more **abundant the qi** (气体愈旺),
The more the **spirit withdraws** (则神愈退藏).
Do not let the **spirit be enslaved by the qi** (勿使神为气役),
Then the **yang spirit** (陽神) will naturally attain **completeness** (圆足).

○ **Chapter Sixty-Nine**.
This speaks of the **phase of holding fullness** (持盈),
Ensuring the **spirit is clear** (神清) and the **qi is still** (气静),
Avoiding **excess or deficiency** (过不及) in either.

chunks.original_text: 此时身中三品已完太素贞白，再得此大赤之真铅交合混凝赤白相间而成红也。 天地髓即指此真铅也。 言到此神与气、精皆已充足，毫无污染，堪为老汞，只须温养功足，待得真铅一点而成红，即为金液还丹。 惟时体内阳神只以静密为事，一任天气流行，到得周圆具足，气亦寂然不动。 白子所谓“冥心凝神，致虚守静，则虚室生白。 ”信乎自然！ 遂觉体镇如山巍巍高大。 俄而一点真铅渊然透起，焕乎赤明之天，是乃天地之髓，即我元性来夏之凭。 饶地掀地翻天，径冲混饨； 我神亦遂浑噩，不识不知，如睡方酣。 片刻之后，顿觉神清气爽，身如火热，心如冰释。 若论进修，此时还须混炼； 若论其效，则性光普照，洞彻幽微，耳闻九天，目视万里，遍体纯阳，金筋玉骨，是乃阳神现形，可以出入自然。 以言乎长生之道，于兹毕矣！ 但恐阳有阴对，尚存六合虚空之见，不能无往来隐现之分，何能与造物者游而柄其终始？ 则非将吾昔时混沌、今时品物，一并交结混炼以成金液大还丹，势有所不能已者矣！ ○上第七十章。 此言阳神已成，正元神初合之时也。 ※此章内一“夺”字，上与《阴符经》所云“盗机”相同。 《左传》云：“《军志》曰，先人有夺人之心。 ”彼言兵贵神速，须乘人之心机未动，先夺其要害耳！ 兹言修已之学，要在神武，先乘己之心机未动，夺取阴阳之枢要而已。 天地髓即阴阳之枢要也。 ] 火候通玄处，古今谁肯传。 未曾知采取，且其问周天。 玄，天也。 言此元性已复，阳神已成，体内无火候可行，火候只在通天之处。 自古及中，谁肯明传？ 只缘世无能还性命之人，亦无寻谁之慧力，则金液大还丹之药尚未知采取，此际之周天火候且莫问及可也。 ○上第七十一章。 此承上章夺字之义，逗见火候端倪。 ] 云散海棠月，春深杨柳风。 阿谁知此意，举目问虚空。 愚按：此时已得太极中元仕以为体，火候只是忘虚合道，一着神气都付相忘之中。 故此章首句言云散而月到海棠，似喻神已大净大明，无声无臭； 次句言春深而风吹杨柳，似喻气已至和至畅，无影无踪。 学者切诸身心，完其体段，则首句是形容喜怒哀乐未发之谓中，次句是形容发而皆中乎节之谓和； 象其功用，则首句是模拟三达德为我所良知，即为人人所同得，次句是模拟五达道为我所良能，即为人人所共由。 然以云周天火候之窍妙，尚未见入手精一之旨。 且下文又何以云“目问虚空”？ 此须其人自体自悟，通一毕万，但能自得夫本心之良。 然则动即孚乎人性之同然，静即合夫天命之本然，常涵养其浑然，斯触处而洞然，方知我神与气已早自混化于心目之间，并复泯迹于虚空之际。 何则？ 气之动静随乎神，神固为气之先也； 神之飞潜由乎心，心更为神之先也； 心之先机在乎目，则目实心之先也。 《阴符经》云：“心生于物，死于物，机在目”，是知目为心之先机，实为神气之先务。 故目逃者，则心遁而气阻神丧； 目明内视者，则心清而神凝气浩； 目同虚空者，则心游于物之初而无所住，神气亦湛然常寂。 养到寂无所寂，方知十方三界不外一心，往古来今无非一我； 昔本不生，今亦不灭，昔原不减，今亦无增。 此意如如，阿谁知得？

At this juncture, the three grades within the body have completed the **Pure and Chaste Essence** (太素贞白), and upon obtaining this **true lead of great red** (大赤之真铅), their fusion and congealing—intermingling red and white—yield the crimson.

The **marrow of Heaven and Earth** (天地髓) refers to this very **true lead**. When it is said that the **spirit, qi, and essence** are all fully suffused, utterly undefiled, and ready as **old cinnabar**, it is only that the **nurturing work** is yet insufficient. Once a single point of **true lead** arises and turns crimson, it becomes the **golden elixir of Great Return**.

Yet at this time, the **yang spirit** within the body merely abides in stillness and seclusion. One lets the **Heavenly qi** flow freely, until its completeness is fully realized and the **qi stands motionless in stillness**.

As the **White Boy** said:
*"Concentrate the heart, solidify the spirit,
Attain emptiness, guard stillness—
Then the empty chamber births the white."*

Truly natural!

Then one feels the body steadfast as a towering mountain, vast and high.
Suddenly, a point of **true lead** emerges, deep and piercing—
A radiant red heaven, for this is the **marrow of Heaven and Earth**, the very **original nature returning in summer**.

It stirs the earth and shakes the heavens, surging through the **mixed and chaotic**—
My spirit is thus enveloped in drowsiness,
Unknowing, unaware, as if in deep slumber.

After a moment, one awakens to **clear spirit and refreshed qi**,
The body as if aflame, the heart as ice released.

If speaking of further cultivation,
One must yet engage in **fusion and refinement**;
If speaking of its effects,
Then the **light of nature shines universally**, penetrating the profound and subtle.
One hears the **Nine Heavens**, sees **ten thousand miles**,
The entire body pure **yang**—**golden sinews, jade bones**—
This is the **yang spirit manifesting in form**, able to move freely in nature.

As for the **Dao of longevity**, it is here complete!

Yet fearing that **yang has its yin counterpart**,
And that the **six directions of emptiness** still linger,
Unable to avoid the **coming and going of concealment and revelation**—
How could one then **consort with the Creator** and hold dominion over its beginning and end?

Thus, it is impossible not to **bind together** the **primordial chaos** of the past and the **manifested forms** of now,
And **refine them into the golden elixir of Great Return**.

○ **Chapter Seventy**
This speaks of the **yang spirit already formed**,
The moment when the **original spirit first unites**.

※Within this chapter, the word **"seize"** (夺) aligns with the *Yin Symbol Classic*’s **"steal the mechanism"** (盗机).
The *Spring and Autumn Annals* states:
*"The Military Records say: ‘The ancients had the mind to seize from others.’"*
They speak of war’s value in **spiritual swiftness**—
Seizing the **vital points** before the enemy’s intent even stirs.

Here, the study of cultivation lies in **spiritual might**—
Seizing the **pivotal essence of yin and yang** before one’s own mind moves.

The **marrow of Heaven and Earth** is the **pivotal essence of yin and yang**.

At the **mysterious juncture of fire and time**, who from ancient or modern times would dare transmit it?
None have yet known how to **extract the elixir**,
Nor even inquire about the **circulation of the Microcosmic Orbit**.

*"Play"* (玄) is *"Heaven"* (天).
When the **original nature is restored** and the **yang spirit formed**,
There remains no **fire and time** to be applied within the body—
The **fire and time** lie only in the **path to Heaven**.
From antiquity to now, who would clearly transmit it?
Because the world lacks those who can **restore life and nature**,
Nor those with the wisdom to seek—
Thus the **golden elixir of Great Return** remains unplucked,
And the **fire and time of this Microcosmic Orbit** are not yet to be asked.

○ **Chapter Seventy-One**
This follows the meaning of **"seize"** from the previous chapter,
Revealing the first glimpses of **fire and time**.

*Clouds disperse over the sea-pink moon,
Spring deepens with willow winds.*
Who knows this intent?
Gazing upward, questioning the void.

**Note:** At this stage, one has obtained the **original official of the Great Polarity** as one’s body.
The **fire and time** is merely **forgetting the void to merge with the Dao**—
A single move where **spirit and qi are entrusted to mutual oblivion**.

Thus, the opening line speaks of **clouds dispersing** while the **moon reaches the sea-pink**—
As if the **spirit is now utterly pure and luminous**, without sound or stench.
The next line speaks of **spring deepening** as the **wind blows through the willows**—
As if the **qi is now perfectly harmonious and unrestrained**, leaving no trace.

Scholars must apply this to **body and mind**,
Completing its structure—
The first line describes the **unmanifest emotions** as the **central equilibrium**,
The second describes **manifested emotions in perfect measure** as **harmony**.

In terms of its function,
The first line models the **Three Penetrations of Virtue** as my **inherent knowing**—
That which all share.
The second models the **Five Penetrations of the Dao** as my **inherent ability**—
That which all follow.

Yet regarding the **mysteries of the Microcosmic Orbit’s fire and time**,
The principle of **gathering and refining** has not yet been entered.

And why does the text then say, *"eyes question the void"*?
This must be **self-body and self-enlightenment**—
Unifying one to comprehend all,
Only able to attain the **original heart’s sincerity**.

Thus, in **action**, one aligns with the **common nature of humanity**,
In **stillness**, one merges with the **original mandate of Heaven**,
Ever nurturing the **undivided whole**—
Then everywhere one touches, it is **penetratingly clear**,
And one knows the **spirit and qi** have long since **naturally fused within heart and eyes**,
And **vanished into the void**.

Why?
The **movement and stillness of qi** follow the **spirit**,
Yet the **spirit is always prior to qi**.
The **ascension and concealment of the spirit** depend on the **heart**,
Yet the **heart is even prior to the spirit**.
The **first impulse of the heart** lies in the **eyes**—
Thus the **eyes are truly the heart’s first impulse**,
The **primary concern of spirit and qi**.

As the *Yin Symbol Classic* says:
*"The heart is born from things, dies from things—
Its mechanism lies in the eyes."*
Thus it is known that the **eyes are the first impulse of the heart**,
The **true priority of spirit and qi**.

If the **eyes flee**, then the **heart withdraws** and **qi is obstructed**, the **spirit perishes**.
If the **eyes are clear and inwardly gazing**, then the **heart is pure**, the **spirit condenses**, and the **qi expands**.
If the **eyes merge with the void**, then the **heart wanders at the origin of things** without attachment,
And the **spirit and qi** remain **serene and ever still**.

When nurturing reaches **stillness without stillness**,
One knows the **ten directions and three realms** are not outside the **One Heart**,
Past and future are not separate from the **One Self**—
Originally unborn, now unextinguished,
Originally unreduced, now unincreased.

This **suchness**—who knows it?

chunks.original_text: 曾以此义叩师于太虚之安居，师正持无字观音之经，遂言曰：“首句是令人见月之指，不可认指为月； 次句如角风之旗，不可认旗为风。 盖当雷雨满形之后，肇开光风霁月之场。 首句一散字，犹云‘但得置身天际坐，莫须回首白云低。 ’——神也性之命也，而何可执喻为神也？ 次句一深字，犹云‘等闲识得东风面，万紫千红总是春。 ’——气也命之性也，而何可偏喻为气也？ 余师泥丸尝留道偈，有曰：‘杨柳也当明月舞，海棠亦为好风娇。 ’又云：‘漫空云散家家月，大地春来处处花。 ’正是澹荡天光，无边明镜，互相容受，莫可端倪。 子但坚贞处密、定慧、等观，斯自诚而明，则明无或昧，于以尽天命之性，而性命合元，尚何有虚空之可忘？ 而观自然以合道，即与道合真，永保真空无碍之休焉。 ”遂稽首而称颂曰：“我在太虚中，空明无一物。 自在即天真，清风吹浩月”。 如是大乘正宗虚无妙道，若非向日积持念诚恒之力，会得半句先机，由我师虚空藏印证确实，纵使走遍天涯，阿谁能知此意耶？ ※《易·屯卦彖辞》“雷雨之动满盈。 ”盈字，汉儒注本作“形”字，盖指屯卦二三四爻为一抽象也。 全真先辈俱从形字解，今仍之。 ○上第七十二章。

「Once, I inquired about this meaning from my teacher during his abode in the **Great Void (Tàixū)**.
The teacher was reciting the *Sutra of the Wordless Guan Yin*,
and thus spoke: **"The first sentence is like pointing at the moon to make others see it—
do not mistake the finger for the moon itself.
The second sentence is like the flag of a horned demon—
do not mistake the flag for the wind.**

Indeed, after the **thunder and rain fill the form (xíng)**,
the scene of **radiant light, clear wind, and the moon’s brilliance (guāngfēngjìyuè)** unfolds.
The first sentence, with its **dispersion (sàn)**, is akin to the verse:
*—But if one only sits in the heavens’ expanse, no need to turn back and see the white clouds dip low.*
—**This is the Dao/Way of the spirit, the very essence of life (xìng)**,
yet how can one cling to the metaphor and call it the **spirit** itself?
The second sentence, with its **depth (shēn)**, is akin to the verse:
*—Casually recognizing the face of the east wind, one sees all purple and red blossoms—spring’s very self.*
—**This is the nature of qi, the very essence of life (mìng)**,
yet how can one narrowly call it only the **qi**?

My teacher, the **Dirt Pellet (Níwán) Master**, once left behind a **Dao/Way verse (dàojì)**,
which reads: *"The willows too should dance beneath the bright moon,
the magnolias bloom in the fine wind’s embrace."*
And again: *"The clouds drift freely, each home holds the moon,
the earth blooms with spring, flowers appear everywhere."*
This is precisely the **serene and boundless light of heaven (dàn dàng tiān guāng)**,
an **unlimited mirror of clarity (wúbiān míngjìng)**,
mutually containing and receiving all things,
without fixed boundary or trace.

You must only **steadfastly abide in the close, subtle (mì), concentration, and insight (dìnghuì),
and the equal observation (děngguān)**—
then from sincerity comes clarity,
and clarity knows no obscurity.
Thus, you fulfill the **Dao/Way’s true nature of life (tiān mìng xìng)**,
and **nature and life merge with the Original (yuán)**—
how then could the **Great Void (xūkōng)** be forgotten?

To **observe nature (zìrán)** and **merge with the Dao/Way (hé Dào)**,
is to **unite with the Dao/Way’s true essence (hé Dào zhēn)**,
and **eternally preserve the boundless rest of true emptiness (wúài zhēng)**.»

Thus, bowing deeply, he praised:
*"I dwell within the **Great Void (Tàixū)**,
where **emptiness and clarity (xūmíng)** hold nothing at all.
**Freedom is the Original Nature (zìrán)**,
the **True Self of Heaven (tiān zhēn)**—
cool winds stir the vast moon."*

Such is the **Great Vehicle’s true teaching (Dàchéng zhèngzōng) of the wondrous Dao/Way of emptiness (xūwú miàodào)**.
If not for the **accumulated strength of sincere and steadfast contemplation (jiǒuxīng héngzhī)**,
how could one grasp even half a sentence’s **initial insight (xiān jī)**?
This was **authenticated by my teacher, the Great Void Treasure (Xūkōng Zàng)**—
even if one travels to the ends of the world,
who could truly know this meaning?

※From the *Yì·Tún Cò Guà* (I Ching, Tún Hexagram Commentary):
*"The movement of thunder and rain is full and overflowing."*
The **Han scholar’s annotation (xíng)** originally reads *"swelling (yíng)"*,
but this refers to the **abstract unity of the second, third, and fourth lines of the Tún hexagram**.
All the **Perfect Reality (Quánzhēn)** predecessors interpreted it as *"form (xíng)"*—
I follow this tradition here as well.
○[End of Chapter Seventy-Two]」

This follows the previous chapters, pointing to the **alchemical fire-refinement (tōngxuán)**—
the very **initial insight (xiān jī)** of **unifying the Primordial (héyuán)**.
By **integrating the Three Treasures** with the *Emerald Chamber’s* **Lü Xiucai’s single secret (Dìníhuán Chǔixū Yín Lǚ Xiūcāi yījué)**,
one comes to know the **subtle body and its wondrous application (miàotǐ miàoyòng)**—
its **vast and minute (guǎngdà jīngwēi)** nature,
revealing the **True Realm of the Great Void (Tàixū Zhēnjìng)** in such ineffable splendor.

○[**Human affairs weigh nothing upon one**,
**Heaven’s path offers the steps of the Immortal.**]
Already **mastering cloud-riding**,
**Awaiting the crane’s arrival to ascend the void.**

When the **secret is directly attained (jié)**,
then **all dross is refined into pure gold (jiàngjìn yínchún)**,
**Smoke and fire are extinguished (yānxīo huǒmiè)**—
**embracing all phenomena (bāohán wànxiàng)**,
**without a thread remaining (bùguà yīsī)**.
Human **entanglements dissolve (wùlèi wúguān)**,
**Heaven’s Immortal path is now within reach (xiānjiē yǒufèn)**.

Yet one **does not dare ride the clouds alone**,
but **waits in reverence for the crane’s arrival to pierce the heavens (chōngxiāo)**.

**Teaching others** is not to **boast of concealment or revelation (chūrù yǐnxiǎn)**—
**only thus can one attain the Dao of transformation and ascension (zàobiàn fēishēng zhīdào)!**

This continues from the last chapter—
**having clarified the fire-refinement (huǒhòu)**, one now **reaches the realm of elixir completion (dānchéng zhījìng)**.
○[**The heart-field is free of weeds (xīntián wúcǎohuì)**,
**The nature-ground is utterly free of dust (xìngdì juéchénfēi).**]

chunks.original_text: 夜静月明处，一声春鸟啼。 夜静月明处，指无极太极互相隐现之象，以喻静极初动，正阳神合元之时。 一声春鸟啼，指无极中有一点真机发动之象。 言既处密、定慧、等观，心性自然明净，但自和光同尘，有道而不见其道，有德而不见其德，与世间愚夫愚妇一般面目、一样举动。 随缘度人，多方利物，即或垂手入廛、入净出垢，无所不可。 功圆行满，自得无极中发一真机，即我先天二五之精，便是天一所自出之金，先儒周子谓为“无极之真”、陈泥丸谓之“一盏鸿蒙酒”是也。 饵之便可脱却阴阳，不受五行之束缚矣！ ○上第七十四章。 此言温养元神之道。 ] 白金烹六卦，黑锡过兰关。 半夜三更里，金乌入广寒。 白金，喻元神已纯一不二，正如金液乍还之象。 六卦，震兑乾巽艮坤，六气循环周行不息，为一太极之象。 曰烹者，至虚不宰之谓也。 黑锡即铅也，喻阳神既得元神内守，体已至柔至顺，正如铅锡待点之象。 三关谓混炼元精元气元神三品递化还虚之道，言到此三铅俱就也。 半夜三更里，指无极元始真机将动之时，即上章之夜静月明处也。 金乌，亦取三足之义，在天为日魂，此以借喻元始真机，即上章之春鸟也。 上章但得声闻，此处乃是缘觉。 广寒以象太极。 言到温养时足，元性已含六气以周流至虚不宰，元命已历三关而诣极无道可行，尔时无极中自然发一真机，即我妙无元始一气来复，混合元神，是为金液大还； 遂尔真元迸出，方为妙道真人。 其实金乌即指我元性静极而复动也，广寒即指我元命因性之动而顺与合符，一如日月之合璧，斯为性命合一。 即吾师所谓时而合元之道，并非另有一个真机外至者也，亦非心思计虑所能掇合者也。 真实虚无自然之妙道也，故得之而成真，称为妙道真人——可以经世，可以遁世。 如狮子之迷踪，狮子不足以拟其迹； 如神龙之变化，神龙亦不足以比其灵。
chunks.translated_text:
**Under the moonlit quiet of the night, a single spring bird’s cry.**
Here, the "moonlit quiet of the night" refers to the interplay of **Wuji** (無極) and **Taiji** (太極) in mutual concealment and revelation—
illustrating the moment when **stillness reaches its peak and primal movement begins**, when **True Yang-qi harmonizes with the Original (yuán)**.

The "single spring bird’s cry" signifies the emergence of a single **true seed of transformation** from **Wuji**—
my **preheaven Five Phases essence (yuánxīng)**, the **golden elixir** born from **Heaven’s One (Tiānyī)**,
which the ancient scholar **Zhou Dunyi** called **"Wuji’s True Essence" (wújí zhīzhēn)**,
and **Chen Ti’an** named **"a single cup of Hongmeng wine" (yīzhǎn hóngméng jiǔ)**.

Once ingested, it frees one from **Yin-Yang’s bonds**,
no longer bound by the **Five Phases’ constraints**!

○**[Chapter Seventy-Four]**
This speaks of the **Dao of nurturing the Original Spirit (yuánshén)**.**

---

**White gold simmers through the Six Changes (liùguà),**
**Black tin passes the Orchid Pass (Lán Guān).**
Within the **third watch of the night (bàn yè sān gēng),**
**The golden crow enters the Palace of Broad Cold (Guǎng Hán).**

**White gold**—the **Original Spirit now refined into singular, undivided purity**, like the **golden elixir’s sudden return**.

The **Six Changes (zhèn duì qián xùn gèn kūn)**—
the **Six Qi** in cyclical flow, unceasing, embodying **Taiji’s movement**.
"To simmer" means **reaching supreme emptiness, uncarved**.

**Black tin** is **lead (qiān)**, symbolizing the **Yang-Spirit**, now having **internalized the Original Spirit**,
its body **softened and compliant**, like **lead and tin awaiting ignition**.

The **Three Passes (sānguān)**—
the **mixing and refining of Original Essence, Original Qi, and Original Spirit (yuánjīng yuánqì yuánshén)**,
each transforming and returning to **void**.
This is when the **three leads are all perfected**.

Within the **third watch of the night**—
the moment when **Wuji’s primal seed of transformation stirs**, as in the **"moonlit quiet"** of the last chapter.
The **golden crow**, also bearing the **Three Legs’ meaning (sānjǔ)**, is the **soul of the sun** in heaven—
here, it borrows to signify the **primal seed of transformation**, the **"spring bird"** of the last chapter.
The last chapter spoke of **Hearing-Vehicles**; here, it is **Causally Awakened**.

**Broad Cold** mirrors **Taiji**.

When **nurturing is complete**, the **Original Nature contains the Six Qi in ceaseless circulation**,
**reaching uncarved void**—
the **Original Command has passed the Three Passes**, arriving at **Wuji**, where **no further Dao can be practiced**.
Then, **Wuji’s true seed naturally erupts**—
my **wondrous Original One-Qi (miàowú yuánqì)** returns and **mixes with the Original Spirit**,
becoming the **Great Return of Golden Elixir**.

Thus, **True Original-Qi bursts forth**,
and one becomes a **True Person of the Wondrous Dao**—
**able to endure the world, or withdraw from it**.

Like the **Lion’s hidden tracks**, no lion can trace its path;
like the **Spirit Dragon’s transformations**, no dragon can compare its **mystic agility**.

**only thus can one attain the Dao of transformation and ascension (zàobiàn fēishēng zhīdào)!**
○[End of Chapter Seventy-Three]

This continues from the last chapter—

chunks.original_text: 渊乎妙哉，至矣神矣！ 文王所以系乾之“用九”而“见群龙无首”之吉也。 是谓炼虚合道，性命会无，浑太极而常存。 然初得天地之元宗，尚须与道合真，方保永无堕落也。 ○上第七十五章。 此言元神合道之时也。 ] 丹熟无龙虎，火终体汞铅。 脱胎已神化，更作玉清仙。 丹指真人之体，火指真人之心，玉清乃元始妙无上帝之圣境。 此承上章，言炼虚合道，尚未与道合真。 必也连此之真体，不复存心身定慧之见； 并此真心，不复有阴阳神气之分。 惟尽至诚之道，笃无息之恭； 无意以藏神，更不必假虚以含实； 无必以养心，更不必烹卦以息机； 无固以安身，更不必透关以炼形； 无我以应物，更不必持念以付事。 十方三界，不出一堂； 往古来今，无非一我。 缘觉声闻，冰销雪亮，潜现飞跃，运用随机。 以清静心而宏大愿，休铅汞气而界洪钧，真妄悉销，有无不设，方是与道合真，可以脱胎神比——平升玉清，永作大罗仙子； 流传后世，称为一代圣师。 乃为金液大还丹告成之日也。 ○上第七十六章。 此言丹成脱化，与道合真。 ] 塞断黄泉路，冲开紫府门。 如何海赡子，化鹤出泥丸。 紫府乃东华青童木公，道君即全真大教主，东华紫府铺元立极，少阳帝君选仙之所。 言必须丹成脱化与道合真，方是塞断黄泉之路永不复走，迳登道祖之门听候选仙，上则荣膺天爵，下为一代宗师。 上文以寒蟾喻谷神之成，以玉蟾喻阳神之壮，兹以海蟾喻元神已得无极中真机点化，遂尔透出泥丸如鹤冲举——以鹤喻真人，言修炼之士如蟾化鹤，非指南宗启教之海蟾刘公也。 ○上第七十七章。 此言脱胎神化，上朝道祖，乃证果成真也。
chunks.translated_text:
**How profound and wondrous! How perfect and divine!**

The **Wen Wang** thus bound **Heaven’s** *"Use Nine"* and beheld *"the group dragons without a head"*—a most auspicious sign.
This is called **refining the void and uniting with the Dao**,
where **nature and life merge as one**,
and the **Taiji remains ever whole**.

Yet though one first obtains the **Original Ancestral Essence of Heaven and Earth**,
one must still **unite with the Dao’s true essence** to **forever avoid decline**.

---
**Chapter Seventy-Five (above)**
This speaks of the moment when the **Original Spirit unites with the Dao**.

When the **elixir is ripe**, there are **no longer Dragon and Tiger**—
the **fire terminates in the body of Mercury and Lead**.
Having **shed the mortal coil and attained divine transformation**,
one then becomes a **Pure-Clear Immortal**.

The **elixir** refers to the **True Person’s body**,
the **fire** to the **True Person’s heart**,
and **Pure-Clear** is the **sublime domain of the Most High, Original Beginning, Miao Wu**.

This follows the previous chapter,
speaking of **refining the void and uniting with the Dao**—
yet still **not fully merging with the Dao’s true essence**.
One must **connect with this true body**,
no longer clinging to perceptions of **heart, body, or wisdom**;
and **this true heart**,
no longer divided into **yin-yang, spirit, or qi**.

Only through **exhausting the Dao of utmost sincerity**,
and **devoting unceasing reverence**,
does one **hide the spirit without intent**,
and **need not feign emptiness to contain reality**;
**nurture the heart without constraint**,
nor **boil the hexagrams to still the vital mechanism**;
**secure the body without rigidity**,
nor **pierce the passes to refine the form**;
**respond to things without self**,
nor **cling to thought to attend to affairs**.

The **ten directions and three realms** lie within a single hall;
**past and future** are but **one self**.
**Hinayana and Mahayana disciples**—
like ice melting and snow brightening—
**emerge, vanish, soar, and leap**,
acting spontaneously in accordance with circumstances.

With a **serene and vast heart**, one **broadens the great aspiration**,
and **resting the lead-mercury qi**, one **expands the cosmic balance**.
When **true and false are utterly extinguished**,
and **being and non-being are not distinguished**,
only then has one **truly united with the Dao**—
able to **shed the mortal coil and attain divine comparison**—
**ascending to Pure-Clear**,
**forever becoming a Great Luo Immortal**;
**transmitted through the ages**,
known as a **sage teacher of an era**.

This is the day the **Great Return of Golden Elixir** is complete.

---
**Chapter Seventy-Six (above)**
This speaks of the **elixir’s completion and divine transformation**, merging with the Dao’s true essence.

**The Yellow Springs’ path is sealed shut**,
**the Purple Palace’s gate is burst open**.
How could **Hai Zhan’s son**—
**transformed into a crane**, emerging from the **muddy homunculus**?

The **Purple Palace** is where **Dong Hua Qing Tong Mu Gong** resides,
the **Dao Lord** is the **founder of the Full-Perfection Teaching**.
**Dong Hua’s Purple Palace** is where the **Primordial Foundation is established**,
and the **Minor Yang Emperor** selects immortals.

It is said that **only when the elixir is complete and one has undergone divine transformation—merging with the Dao’s true essence—**
does one **forever seal the Yellow Springs’ path**,
**directly ascending to the Dao Ancestor’s gate** to await selection as an immortal,
**ascending to receive celestial honors**,
or **becoming a sage teacher of an era**.

The earlier text likened the **Cold Hare** to the **completion of the Valley Spirit**,
and the **Jade Hare** to the **vigorous Yang Spirit**.
Now, the **Sea Hare** signifies that the **Original Spirit has obtained the true mechanism of Wuji’s transformation**,
thus **piercing the muddy homunculus like a crane taking flight**—
using the **crane as a metaphor for the True Person**,
speaking of the **cultivator’s transformation from hare to crane**,
not referring to **Liu Gong, the Southern School’s Sea Hare**.

---
**Chapter Seventy-Seven (above)**
This speaks of **shedding the mortal coil and divine transformation**,
**ascending to pay homage to the Dao Ancestor**—
the **final attainment of fruit and true essence**.

chunks.original_text: ] 江海归何处，山岩属甚人。 金丹成熟后，总是屋中珍。 金液大还丹之道，通篇已三复详明，犹恐世人读之知而不好，好而不乐。 推其原故，只是眷恋尘情，发不出一个正念炼己筑基。 故复特发此章，言到金丹成熟之后，即与太虚同体，世间江海山岩都来抛撇，总是家珍。 言江山，则凡细于江山者概之矣。 教人尽管放下万缘，坚持一念，自然修真有路，进道无魔，必可成功，还将度世，否则无常一到“万般将不去，惟有业随易。 ”那时虽悔何追乎！ ○上第七十八章。 此为激发人之正念而作，故言丹成之后与天为体，山河大地总是家珍。 古人所谓“皇皇八荒，皆在我闼”，岂虚言哉！ ] 吕承钟口诀，葛授郑心传。 总没闲言语，都来只汞铅。 吕即道祖纯阳帝君，钟谓正阳帝君钟离翁也。 葛指老葛仙翁字孝仙，即太极左公仙翁也。 郑谓思远郑真人。 自古来修仙得道高真不可胜计，如吕葛两仙翁，人莫不知，无不敬信，而其所传口诀皆无别说，都来只是汞铅而已，教人不必旁信他说、身外求道也。 ○上第七十九章。 言此还源丹法，确是古圣的传、易简至道，不似别品异术其法烦难也。 ] 汞铅归一鼎，日月要同炉。 进火须防忌，教君结玉酥。 此言丹道总诀：汞铅要归于一，性情务使和同。 其间烹炼、沐浴、进火、退火之际，大要防忿忌欲，抽添适中； 必须夙夜有密，则物我两忘，六根清静，方寸澄清，自然凝结成丹。 曰玉酥者，言能如是藏神养气，自然于温润缜密之中，兼细腻融和之妙。 始终三大交关，皆能如是温养，自不费力，其成甚速也。 ○上第八十章。 此明丹道之总诀。 ] 采药并交结，进火与沐浴。 及至脱胎时，九九阳数足。 此章总结全篇，点明炼丹功夫具有次序条目，教人循序进修，及至数足纯阳，自然脱胎神化，飞升成道。 读者慎勿辜负此篇恺切教人以返本还源之至意焉。 ○上第八十一章。 点明丹诀次序，遂以总结通篇八十章之意。 按：此篇大段功诀，始于有为，终于无为。 有为之功，只是正位凝命，养我浩然； 无为之诀，只是自强不息，养其无形。 吾师尝语人曰：“人必端直其体、空洞其心，真一其念，则得诀炼丹自是容易。 即不修炼，亦足却病延年，老而强健。 ”是真入手之总持正决也。 盖能端直其体，则身无跛倚之容，其五官四肢百骸悉归整饬而外物难干也； 空洞其心，则气机充畅，其通体脉络筋骨皆无积滞而气得返乎虚也； 真一其念，则遇事率真，中无犹豫，而心中阴精随时兼凝于正气，结而成神，神遂得还其实也。 是身心意三家常会于一，谷神长养于不知不觉之中，身其康强乃自然之功效。 子故谓还源之法，必先坚持正念。 正念诚则体自端直而心自空洞，心既空洞则药生而火必正，断无金木间隔之患，亦无水火不济之虞，惟神与气妙合而凝。 此中即有根蒂，然后养其无形，驯致乎无象无体，而金液大还矣！ 金为天一所自出之金，液乃天一将生水之液。 大还者，即以此二五之精妙合而凝为太极，以还我无极之先天也。 全液既凝，加以沐浴温养之功，日积月累，从微至着，以成可大可久之德业，此身有不成金刚不坏之法身者乎！ 源本如是也，还源固如是还也。 言下可以恍然于凝精成神之道也。
chunks.translated_text:
Where shall the rivers and seas return?
To whom do mountains and cliffs belong?

Once the **Golden Elixir** ripens,
It is the supreme treasure within one’s halls.

The **Dao of the Great Return Elixir of Golden Fluid** has been expounded in full threefold,
Yet still I fear the world may read it and know yet not cherish it,
Cherish it yet not delight in it.
Its root cause lies in clinging to mundane affections,
Failing to awaken a single true thought to cultivate and establish one’s foundation.

Thus, I further reveal this chapter:
When the Golden Elixir ripens,
It merges with the **Great Void** as one body.
All worldly rivers, seas, mountains, and cliffs are cast aside—
They are but household treasures.
Speaking of mountains and rivers,
I encompass all that is finer than them.
Teach people to cast aside all worldly ties,
Hold fast to a single thought,
And naturally, the path of **True Cultivation** will open,
The Dao will have no obstacles,
Success will be inevitable—
Even enlightenment for others will follow.
Otherwise, when the **Impermanence** arrives,
*"All else will vanish, only karma remains to be transformed."*
Then, even regret will be too late!

---
**Chapter Seventy-Eighth**
This is written to awaken the true thought within people,
Thus stating that once the Elixir ripens,
It becomes one with Heaven—
Mountains, rivers, and the earth are all household treasures.
As the ancients said:
*"The vast eight extremes are all within my gates."*
Was this not true?

---
**Lü Chengzhong’s Oral Instructions, Ge Laoshi’s Transmission to Zheng Xin.**
No idle words—only **mercury and lead**.
Lü refers to **Dao Ancestor Pure Yang Emperor**, the **Pure Yang Emperor Lü**,
While **Zhong** refers to **Zhongli the Elder**, the **True Yang Emperor**.
Ge refers to **Lao Ge the Immortal**, surnamed **Xiaoxian**, the **Taiji Left Elder**.
Zheng refers to **Zheng Zhenren, Master of Thoughtful Retreat**.
From ancient times, countless **High Immortals** attained the Dao through cultivation—
Like Lü and Ge, whom all know and revere.
Yet their transmitted oral instructions contain no extraneous words—
Only **mercury and lead**,
Teaching people not to seek the Dao through external beliefs or external means.

---
**Chapter Seventy-Ninth**
This speaks of the **Original Elixir Method**,
The **easy and simple Dao** of ancient sages,
Not like other obscure arts whose methods are complex and difficult.

---
**Mercury and lead return to one crucible,
Sun and moon must share the same furnace.**
When refining fire, beware of anger and desire,
Teach you to **congeal the Jade Acid Butter**.

This reveals the **ultimate secret of Elixir Cultivation**:
Mercury and lead must merge as one,
Their natures must harmonize.
In the stages of **cooking, bathing, and refining fire**,
The essence lies in avoiding wrath and lust,
Adjusting the heat with precision—
Day and night, maintain utmost secrecy,
Then **self and object merge**, the six senses grow still,
The mind becomes clear—
Naturally, the Elixir congeals.
The term **"Jade Acid Butter"** speaks of
Nurturing the **Spirit** and **qi** so thoroughly
That within **warmth, refinement, and harmony**,
It achieves the subtlest fusion.
From beginning to end, the **Three Great Intersections** are all thus nurtured,
Requiring no effort—
Its completion is swift.

---
**Chapter Eightieth**
This elucidates the **ultimate secret of Elixir Cultivation**.

---
**Gathering herbs and forming connections,
Refining fire and bathing in elixir.**
When the time of **shedding the mortal coil** arrives,
The **nine times nine of pure Yang** will be complete.

This chapter summarizes the entire text,
Clarifying the **ordered stages of Elixir Cultivation**,
Teaching people to progress step by step—
When the **pure Yang** is complete,
Naturally, the **transformation of Spirit and form** occurs,
And one ascends to become an Immortal.
Readers must not squander this **sincere guidance** to return to the Origin!

---
**Chapter Eighty-First**
This marks the sequence of the Elixir instructions,
Concluding the meaning of all eighty chapters.

**Note:** This entire section on techniques begins with **deliberate action**
And ends with **effortless spontaneity**.
The **deliberate action** is to **rectify the body, stabilize the vital breath,**
And **nurture the boundless and sincere**.
The **effortless spontaneity** is to **strengthen oneself unceasingly,**
And **nurture the formless**.

My teacher once said to people:
*"If one straightens their body, empties their mind,
And makes their thought **True One**,
Then practicing the Elixir instructions will naturally be easy.
Even without cultivation, it suffices to **ward off illness and prolong life**,
And to remain strong in old age."*

This is indeed the **fundamental and supreme method** for beginners.

For if one straightens their body,
Their posture will have no crookedness or leaning,
And their **five senses, four limbs, and hundred bones**
Will all be orderly—
External things will find no way to disturb them.
If one empties their mind,
The **flow of qi** will be unobstructed,
And their **entire body’s meridians, tendons, and bones**
Will have no stagnation—
Thus, the **qi returns to the Void**.
If one makes their thought **True One**,
They will act with sincerity,
With no hesitation in their heart—
Then, the **yin essence** within will naturally congeal with the **true qi**,
Forming the **Spirit**, which then returns to its origin.

Thus, **body, mind, and intention** are always united,
And the **Valley Spirit** is nourished in **unconscious awareness**—
Strength and vitality naturally follow.

Therefore, the **Method of Returning to the Origin**
Must first uphold a **true thought**.
If the **true thought** is sincere,
Then the body will naturally straighten,
And the mind will naturally empty.
Once the mind is empty,
The **medicine arises**, and the **fire will be true**—
There will be no fear of **metal and wood obstruction**,
Nor of **water and fire failing to aid each other**.
Only when **Spirit and qi** merge in subtlety
Does the **Elixir congeal**.
Within this lies the **root**—
Then nurture the **formless**,
Gradually leading to **no form, no body**,
And the **Great Return of Golden Fluid** will be achieved!

**Gold** is the **Heavenly One’s** self-generated metal,
**Fluid** is the **Heavenly One’s** pre-natal water essence.
The **Great Return** is when these **Five Agents’** refined essences merge and congeal,
Restoring the **Taiji** to the **Wuji** of **Prenatal Heaven**.
Once the **entire fluid congeals**,
Add the **functions of bathing and nurturing**,
Day by day, month by month,
From subtle to manifest,
To achieve **enduring and vast virtue**—
How could the body not become an **indestructible Golden Body**?

The **Source** is as such,
And **Returning to the Source** is as such.
From these words, one may suddenly awaken to the **Dao of Congealing Essence into Spirit**.

The **Method of Settling the Furnace** is to observe the initial three to four slender months of the moon’s cycle—
when the intention of **nurturing and resting** is most harmonious and wondrous beyond words,
hence the saying: *"Refining the elixir requires seeking the reclining crescent furnace"* (the furnace base is pressed firmly against the lower palate, with the body tilted upward on all fours).

The furnace base must be **expansive and void**, resting gently upon the **Lianquan** spring,
while the furnace edges hover near the **lower teeth and Huiyan** junction** (the throat’s opening),
descending like a pendulum, its force clinging close to the **rear of the throat**,
as though an infant were suckling—
then the **qi** and breath will easily descend.

If the furnace base is **fully hollowed**,
the **Heavenly One’s** **Spring-Summer-Growth-Autumn-Storage-Winter-Hiding** cyclical **qi**
will enter through the **Xuanpin** (the nostrils),
flooding the **Dantian** and traversing the **Governing** and **Conception Vessels**,
not merely manifesting in men as the **testicles’ contraction** as proof,
nor in women as the **breasts’ contraction** (the method of **massaging the breasts** is utterly mistaken)—
but also, the **qi** will naturally reach the soles,
and one will feel the **Yongquan** at the foot’s heart as if ants were crawling.
When this luminous scene appears,
one may say the furnace is **settled** and the elixir is **ripe**.

Once this body leaves the mother’s womb,
it gradually forgets the **original path** of its **roots**,
and after one year, the **Governing** and **Conception Vessels’** **pathways** become **blocked** for a year.
If further exposed to **wind, cold, heat, or dampness** of the **evil pathogens**,
the **viscera and bowels** will close and **death** ensue.

Thus, the *Suwen·Tianzhen Lun* begins with:
*"Those who know the **Dao** have their **qi** and **vessels** always **unobstructed**."*
and continues to:
*"The **Sages** transmit the **Heavenly One’s qi** to **penetrate Spirit and Mind**."*
Yet its words are **brief** and lack detail.

Still, even **Huangdi and Qibo** (the Yellow Emperor and his minister) held this method in such high regard,
and now, for mortals to **clear and unblock the Governing and Conception Vessels’ pathways**—
how could this be easy?

It must be done at the **child and noon hours**, seated facing south,
striving to **close the breath** as though it were **not exhaled**.
With all one’s might, direct the **qi** downward and **hold the breath**,
repeating this **once, twice, or thrice**,
up to ten, twenty, or thirty times—
there will surely come a day when the **pathways are cleared**.

It is best practiced in **winter months**,
when the **Heavenly One’s qi** is **concealed** and **yang** is **hidden**—
then the **qi** will be **conserved** without harm.

If done **gradually and leisurely**,
one must wait a full year before the **pathways** will open!

**The Return to Source Chapter**

The Sage Tai Su sought the **Dao** of the True Essence,
and wandered through all sacred realms.
He received the **orthodox method** in transmission,
and vowed to take **saving the world** as his heart’s purpose;
yet he singled out **preserving the Three** above all,
and placed **nourishing life** as his highest priority.
For he said: *"Learning the art of immortality is easy, yet mortals struggle;
escaping the dust is not hard, yet mortals find it difficult—
how lamentable this is!"*

The ancients spoke:
*"Clouds obscure the moon of wisdom,
winds of karma scatter the ocean of tranquility."*

In years past,
by chance, he encountered his **preceptor**, the **Venerable Sage of Purple Yang**, Master Zhang.
His words of **ease** were but half a sentence;
his **verification and efficacy** were but fleeting moments.
Yet knowing that immortality could be **learned**,
he privately rejoiced in his discovery.
When the **golden elixir** was **refined** and the **sage’s embryo** formed,
Tai Su composed *The Return to Source Chapter* in **eighty-one sections** (to correspond with the **pure yang of yin and yang’s cycles**),
each in **four lines of five characters**,
to instruct those who came late to the **Dao**.

*"Awaken early to the **True Essence**,
do not wait until old age when **lead and mercury** are depleted!*
*Act swiftly and resolutely—
**seek the teacher** and **pursue the Way**.*
*Refine the **golden vessel** together,
and **ascend to immortality** as one.*
*When the **elixir** transforms and **ascends**,
this is what I truly desire.*

*The **lead** and **mercury** form the **True Body**,
**yin** and **yang** unite to create the **Great Primordial**.*
*Once the **Twenty-Eight Movements** are known,
the **golden elixir** can be **refined**.*

*Mercury is the **essence of the Azure Dragon**,
**lead** is the **fat of the White Tiger**.*
*Gather them within the **cauldron**,
and **harvest** them at the **right moment**.*
*How wondrous!—
the **Female of Separation** rides the **White Tiger**,
the **Golden Sage** straddles the **Mercury Dragon**.*
*When **Geng** and **Jia** align in **harmony**,
a single **refinement** yields **red**.*

*With **snake’s essence** and **dragon’s marrow**,
and **tortoise’s soul** tempering the **Tiger’s essence**,
within the **Divine Pool’s waters**,
two **celestial mushrooms** emerge.*
*The **White Snow** ascends to the **Jade Terrace**,
the **yellow sprout** blossoms in the **Jade Garden**.*
*If you know the **False Moon**,
where then do you **refine the red lead**?*

*The **medicinal materials** are **united in the Primordial Void**,
the **fire’s intensity** is **cultivated in the Great Darkness**.*
*In the **tenth month**, the **embryo of immortality** forms,
only then is the **Ninefold Transformation** known.*
*Where the **Dragon King hides his pearl**,
the **rooster clutches the **Dao** at **cock’s crow**.*
*Who knows that **lead and mercury** unite?
Just then, the **elixir of the **Great Primordial** can be consumed.*

*Bathing in **spittle** nourishes the **Eternal Feminine**,
**breathing** relies on the **wings of the **Dao**’s wind**.*
*The **babe** has not yet spoken a word,
alone in the **Great Mystery’s chamber**.*
*He seeks the **Female of Separation** in **Purple Palace**,
and pairs the **Male of the **Dao**’s **Jade Terrace** with the **Female of the **Kan**’s **Abyss**.*
*The **Yellow Matron** arranges the **marriage**,
and the **Great Primordial** naturally **encloses the Three**.*

*The **Celestial Horse of **Kan** gallops through the **Golden Door**,
the **Earthly Ox of **Li** enters the **Wood Palace**.*
*Who would wed the **Snake’s Daughter**,
to the **Golden Sage**?*

*The **Bride** is **Twenty-Eight**,
the **Groom** is the **Dragon’s Three**.*
*The **nuptial chamber** emits **auspicious qi**,
and their union brings forth the **Firstborn Male**.*

*Last night, upon the **Western State’s banks**,
the **pond’s light** illuminated the **emerald waves**—
**returning**, they enter the **Royal Domain**,
within the **cauldron**, self-**refinement** begins.*

*The **Female of Separation** and the **Male of the **Kan**’s **Abyss** are not **wedded sisters**,
yet the **Great Primordial** naturally **transforms and gives birth**.*
*If mortals grasp this principle,
a single point will **fall into the Yellow Court**.*

*The **Elixir Valley** grows the **Divine Tree**,
the **Yellow Court** holds the **Great Treasury**.*
*No longer craving hunger or thirst,
one **ascends directly** to the **Immortal Realm**.*

*The **Mind-Horse** returns to the **Divine Chamber**,
the **Heart-Monkey** guards the **nuptial chamber**.*
*The **spirit, soul, and intent**,
transformed into **purple-golden frost**.*

*One **orifice** is the **Mysterious Female**,
within which **qi** and **spirit** are **hidden**.*
*Who knows this **orifice**?
Then do not **seek the Way** beyond.*

*The **spleen and stomach** are not the **Divine Chamber**,
the **flanks** are but **excess of the kidneys**.*
*I urge you not to cling to **dogma**,
for this is not the **Elixir’s pivot**.*

*Within the **inner landscape**, a thousand verses arise,
yet a single **goblet of **Yellow Court** wine** suffices.*
*When **emptiness** is **encountered** without obstruction,
**heaven and earth** lie within the **self**.*

*The **bird and hare** **roast each other**,
the **tortoise and snake** **wrap around one another**.*
*Transformed into a **single grain of elixir**,
**nurtured**, it becomes the **embryo of immortality**.*

*All things undergo **birth and death**,
yet the **Primordial Spirit** dies and **rebirths**.*
*By **returning the spirit to the **qi** within**,
the **Way of the Elixir** naturally **manifests**."*

chunks.original_text: 神气归根处，身心复命时，这般真孔窍，料得少人知。 身里有玄牡，心中无垢尘，不知谁解识，一窍内涵真。 离坎真龙虎，乾坤正马牛，人人皆具足，因甚不知修。 魂魄为心主，精神以意包，如如行火候，默默运初文。 心下肾上处，肝西肺左中，非肠非胃腑，一气自流通。 妙用非关意，真机不用时，谁能知此窍，且莫任无为。 有物非无物，无为合有为，化权归手内，乌兔结金脂。 虎啸西山上，龙吟北海冻，捉来须野战，寄在良坤官。 复媚司明晦，屯蒙直晓昏，舟炉凝白雪，无处觅心猿。 黑汞生黄叶，红铅绽紫花，更须行火候，鼎里结丹砂。 木液须防兔，金精更忌鸡，抽添须沫浴，正是月圆时。 万赖风初起，千山月半圆，急须行正令，便可运周天。 药材分老嫩，火候用抽添，一粒丹光起，寒蜂射玉帘。 蚌腹珠曾剖，鸡集卵易寻，无中生有物，神气自相侵。 神气非子母，身心岂夫妇，但妥合天机，谁识结丹处。 丹头初结处，药物己凝时，龙虎交相战，东君总不知。 旁门并小法，异本及闲言，金液还舟诀，浑无第二门。 贵贱并高下，夫妻与弟兄，修仙如有分，皆可看丹经。 屋被修容易，药枯生不难，但知归复法，金宝积如山。 魂魄成三性，精神会五行，就中分四象，攒簇结胎精。 定志求铅汞，灰心觅土金，方知真一窍，谁测此幽深？ 造化无根蒂，阴阳有木原，这些真妙处，父子不堪传。 留汞居金鼎，将铅入玉池，主宾无左右，只要识婴儿。 黄婆双乳美，不老片心慈，温养无他术，无中养就儿。 绎阀翔青凤，丹田养玉扮，壶中天不夜，白雪落纤纤。 琴瑟和谐后，箕襄了当时，不须行火候，又恐损婴儿。 长男才入兑，少女便归乾，翼官并土位，关锁自周天。 弦后弦前处，月圆月缺时，抽添象刑德，沫浴按盈亏。 老汞三斤白，真铅一点红，夺他天地髓，交姑片时中。 火候通玄处，古今谁肯传未曾知来药，且莫问周天。 云散海棠月，春深杨柳风，阿谁知此意，举目问虚空。 人间无物累，天上有仙阶，已解乘云了，相将白鹤来。 心田无草秽，性地绝尘飞，夜静月明处，一声春鸟啼。 白金烹六封，黑锡过三关，半夜三更里，金乌人广寒。 舟熟无龙虎，火终休汞铅，脱胎已神化，更作玉清仙。 塞断黄泉路，冲开紫府门，如何海塘子，化鹤出泥丸。 江海归何处，山岩属其人，金丹成熟后，总是屋中珍。 吕承钟口诀，葛授郑心传。 总没闲言语，都采只汞铅。 汞铅归一鼎，日月要同炉，进火须防忌，教君结玉酥。 采药再交结，进火与沫浴，及至脱胎时，九九阳数足。 夫炼金丹之士，须知冬至不在子，沐浴亦非卯酉。 汞铅二物，皆非涕唾津精气血液也。 七返者返本，九还者还源。 金精木液，遇土则交。 龙虎马牛，总皆无相。 先师《悟真篇》，所谓金丹之要，在于神水华池者，即铅汞也。 人能知铅之出处，则知汞之所产。 既知铅与汞，则知神水华池。 既知神水华池，则可以炼金丹。 金丹之功，成于片时，不可执九载三年之日程，不可泥年月日时而运用。 锺离所谓，"四大一身，皆属阴也。 "如是，则不可就身中而求，特可寻身中之一点阳精是也。 然此阳精，在乎一窍，常人不可得而猜度也。 只此一窍，则是玄牝之门，正所谓神水华池也。

「The **Dao** lies where **qi** and **spirit** return to their roots,
when **body** and **mind** restore their **command**.*

This **true orifice** is known to few,
though it holds the **mystery supreme**.

Within the **self** exists the **Primordial Male**,
the **heart** untainted by **filth and dust**.*
Yet none discern its **recognition**—
all **truth** is contained in this **orifice**.

The **True Dragon and Tiger** transcend **Kàn**’s* limits,
**Heaven and Earth** align in **Mǎ Niú**’s* rectitude.*
All possess such **completeness**—
yet why do few know to **cultivate**?

The **hun** and **pò** govern the **heart**,
**shén** and **qì** are bound by **intent**.*
The **firing process** proceeds with **equanimity**,

Below the **heart**, above the **kidneys**,
west of the **liver**, east of the **lungs**’*
—neither **intestines** nor **stomach**—

Its **marvelous use** is not a matter of **will**,
its **true mechanism** not bound by **time**.*
Who knows this **orifice**?
Do not let it **linger in inaction**.

There is **substance** yet not-**substance**,
**inaction** harmonizes with **action**.*
**Alchemical authority** rests within the **hands**,
**Black Hare** and **White Rabbit** fuse into **golden essence**.*

The **Tiger roars** on the **Western Peak**,
the **Dragon hums** in the **Frozen Northern Sea**.*

to **deposit them** is in the **Virtuous Official’s** domain.*

They **adorn** the **minister of brightness and darkness**,
**layering clouds** to pierce **morning’s** and **evening’s** veil.*
The **cauldron** condenses **pure white snow**,
nowhere to **find** the **monkey of the heart**.

**Black Mercury** yields **Yellow Leaves**,
**Red Lead** blooms **Purple Flowers**.*
Still, the **firing process** must be **conducted**,
within the **cauldron**, **cinnabar elixir** forms.

**Wood’s essence** must guard against **Rabbit**,
**Metal’s essence** forbids **Rooster**.*
**Drawing and dripping** must be **bathed in mist**,
precisely when the **moon is full**.

All **depends** on the **first breath of wind**,
a thousand **peaks** beneath the **half-moon’s** glow.*
The **urgent decree** must be **executed**,
then the **circulation of the cosmos** begins.

**Medicinal substances** differ in **maturity**,
**firing stages** require **drawing and dripping**.*
With one **grain of elixir** glowing,
**cold bees** sting the **jade curtain**.

the **egg** was **gathered** from the **Rooster’s** nest.*
**Substance arises from non-substance**,
**spirit and qi** **mutually invade**.

**Spirit and qi** are not **male and female**,
**body and mind** are not **husband and wife**.*

who knows where the **elixir forms**?

The **Dragon and Tiger** first **congeal**,
when the **substances** have **solidified**—
their **clash** is **ignited**,
yet **East Lord** remains **unaware**.

**False paths** and **minor methods**,
**erroneous roots** and **idle chatter**,
the **precept of the Mercury’s Return***
—no **other gate** exists.

**Nobility and humility**,
**husbands and wives**, **brothers and sisters**—
if **Daoist cultivation** has **distinction**,
all may **consult the Elixir Scriptures**.

**Outer garments** are easily **refined**,
**medicinal herbs** **wither** without **difficulty**.*
But know the **method of return and restoration**,
and **golden treasures** will **accumulate like mountains**.

The **hun** and **pò** manifest **three natures**,
**shén** and **qì** **harmonize the Five Phases**.*
Within this, **four symbols** are **divided**,
**clustered** to form the **embryonic essence**.*

**Focus the will** to seek **Lead and Mercury**,
**dispel the mind** to find **Earth’s Metal**.*
Only then does one grasp the **orifice’s mystery**—
who can **fathom** its **depth**?

**Creation** has no **foundation or base**,
yet **yin** and **yang** spring from **Wood’s origin**.*
These **true marvels**,
even **father and son** cannot **fully transmit**.

**Retain Mercury** in the **Golden Cauldron**,
**introduce Lead** into the **Jade Pool**.*
**Host and guest** have no **left or right**—
only **recognize the infant**.

**Yellow Mother’s** twin **breasts** are **beautiful**,
**Non-Aging Child’s** **heart** is **compassionate**.*
To **nurture** requires no **other technique**—
**non-substance** **nourishes the infant**.

**Refining the gate**, the **Azure Phoenix** takes flight,
**Elixir Field** **rears the Jade Embryo**.*
The **cauldron’s heavens** never **darken**,
**white snow** falls in **delicate threads**.

**Jī Xiàng**** is **settled**—

the **youngest daughter** returns to **Heaven**,
**Yì Guān**** and **Tǔ Position** **lock together**,
**circulating** through the **cosmic cycles**.

**Before and after the string**,
when the **moon waxes and wanes**,
**drawing and dripping** mirror **punishment and virtue**,
**mist-bathing** follows **fullness and emptiness**.

**Mature Mercury**, three **catty** of **white**,
**true Lead**, one **point** of **red**,
**plucking Heaven and Earth’s marrow**,
**intercourse with the Maiden** at the **critical moment**.

The **firing process** **penetrates the mystery**,
yet **ancient and modern** few **transmit**—
**unfamiliar substances**,
do not **inquire** about the **cosmic cycles**.

The **wind scatters** the **clouds**,
the **sea’s camellia** blooms in **moonlight**,
the **spring deepens** with **willow’s wind**—
who **understands** this **intent**?
**Gazing upward**, **question the void**.

Between **mortals**, there is no **burden**,
above, the **Path of Immortals** awaits.*
**Having solved** the **Cloud-Riding**,
**accompany the White Crane**.*

The **heart-field** bears no **weeds**,
the **nature-ground** **excludes dust**.*
In the **stillness of night**, **moonlight bright**,
**one cry** of the **spring bird**.

**White Gold** is **boiled in six seals**,
**Black Tin** **crosses three passes**,
by the **third watch**, **Golden Rooster** enters **Broad Cold**.*

When the **vessel is ripe**, there are no **Dragon and Tiger**,
when the **fire is complete**, **Lead and Mercury** are **no more**.*
**Embryo’s escape** marks **spirit-transformation**,
then **ascend** as the **Pure-Clear Immortal**.

**Bar the Yellow Spring’s road**,
**burst open the Purple Treasury’s gate**—
how **Sea-Sand Child**,
**transforms into Crane**, emerging from the **mud-embryo**.

**Where do rivers and seas return**?
**Which mountain and cliff belongs to whom**?
After the **Golden Elixir** **matures**,
it is **always a treasure** of the **chamber**.

**Lǚ Chéng’s** **precept of the Bell-Mouth**,
**Gě Zhōu’s** **transmission of the Heart-Mind**—
no **idle words** remain,
all **gather** only **Lead and Mercury**.

**Lead and Mercury** return to **one cauldron**,
**sun and moon** must **share the furnace**.*
**Advancing fire** must **avoid taboos**,
I **instruct you** to **form Jade Cream**.

**Collecting herbs** must **reunite and congeal**,
**firing** with **mist-bathing**—
until the **embryo’s escape**,
**ninety-nine days** of **yang** **sufficiency**.*

Those who **refine the Golden Elixir**,
must know **winter solstice** is not **at Child**,
**mist-bathing** is not **at Mào Wǔ**.*

**Lead and Mercury** are not **saliva, nasal mucus, or seminal fluid**,
nor **vital breath** or **blood**.

**Seven returns** mean **returning to origin**,
**nine restorations** mean **restoring to source**.*
**Metal’s essence** and **Wood’s essence**,
**meet Earth** and **intermingle**.

**Dragon, Tiger, Horse, Ox**—
all are **formless**.

The **Master’s** *《Awakening to Truth》*,
says the **essence of the Golden Elixir** lies
in the **Spirit-Water Jade Pool**—
that is **Lead and Mercury**.

If one knows **where Lead emerges**,
then one knows **where Mercury is produced**.
Having known **Lead and Mercury**,
one knows the **Spirit-Water Jade Pool**.
Having known the **Spirit-Water Jade Pool**,
one can **refine the Golden Elixir**.

The **Golden Elixir’s merit**,
**achieved in an instant**,
cannot be **measured by nine years or three years**’ **timeline**,
nor **confined to years, months, days, and hours** in **operation**.

**Zhōng Lí’s*** **saying**:
*"The **Four Great Elements** compose **one body**,
all belong to **yin**.*

Thus, one cannot **seek within the body**,
but must **find the single point of yang essence** within it.

Yet this **yang essence**,
dwells in **one orifice**—
**common folk** cannot **guess its location**.

Only this **orifice**,
is the **Primordial Female’s gate**,
the **Spirit-Water Jade Pool** itself.»
